title: Lev Rubinstein, Russian poet and political figure, dies at 76
description: Rubinstein, a poet and political activist since the Soviet era, had recently voiced support for Alexei Navalny, criticized the war in Ukraine and urged “hope.”

title: Yemen’s Houthi militants strike U.S.-owned ship, Centcom says
description: The attack showed that the Houthis were still able to target shipping vessels, just days after U.S.-led strikes against the group.

title: A former Israeli hostage fears for the women she left behind in Gaza
description: Agam Goldstein-Almog, 17, described to The Washington Post the terror and confusion she endured over nearly two months as a Hamas hostage inside Gaza.

title: Maldives asks India to withdraw its military in tilt toward Beijing
description: Relations between India and the Maldives have been strained since Mohamed Muizzu became the Maldives president after a  election campaign promising to push “India Out.”

title: Berlin farmer protest gains wide support amid nation’s winter of discontent
description: As thousands protest in Berlin, concerns grow over how the far-right could capitalize on nationwide discontent with the so-called traffic light coalition government.

title: Taiwan loses another diplomatic ally as Nauru recognizes China
description: Nauru’s decision, which the government said was “in the best interests” of the country, leaves Taiwan with only 12 diplomatic allies.

title: Israel-Gaza war live updates: Israel to continue high-intensity campaign throughout January, U.S. officials say
description: Israel has made clear in discussions that it will not dial down its military campaign this month, U.S. officials told The Post, despite pressure from the United States.

title: Guatemala presidential inauguration delayed by last-minute upheaval
description: Bernardo Arevalo, an anti-corruption crusader, won the presidency in a landslide. But delays in his inauguration Sunday showed the steep obstacles he faces.

title: Despite U.S. pressure on Israel, casualty count in Gaza remains high
description: In the besieged Gaza Strip, civilian casualties remain high and aid deliveries low. The Biden administration has concluded Israel is not heeding its demands.
